website_summaries.verdict: A durable mechanical keyboard that offers up a wide range of features.
pros: Comes in a variety of colors and key/switch configurations
Features include multi-media keys, 10-mode RGB backlighting, and anti-ghosting
Compatible with Windows and Mac OS X
cons: Classic mechanical keyboard noise may be too much for some customers
Some reports of durability issues with the keyboard dying after several months

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mech Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Keyboard! The blue switches feel great, nice tactile feedback. The build quality of the keyboard itself looks top notch and the backlighting is colorful and bright! I have added a video going through the different light modes. I couldn't find how to change lighting modes in the manual, luckily I found it on this product page: FN + PGDN
customer_reviews.author: CaptainChe

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with the keyboard and Andy at E-Element went through great efforts to provide great customer service. Thanks Andy!
customer_reviews.author: Santokki

customer_reviews.title: Incredible keyboard! Incredible value!
customer_reviews.text: For being an unknown brand with knock-off blue switches, this has been one of the best mechanical keyboards I've ever owned. I went as far as to add my own keycaps and custom USB cord. Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value at 46 bucks
customer_reviews.text: My only prior experience with mechanical keyboards have been the Magicforce 68-Keys sold by Qisan. At a similar price point, the RGB lighting you get with this is very nice. The blue switches feel the same as the Magicforce's. I believe they both use Outemu switches. Build quality is good and all keys function and register correctly. I have it connected to my 2010 Mac mini dual booting to OS X 10.6 and 10.11. The smaller right side shift key does take some getting used to. I keep over reaching and press the up arrow key being used the normal sized ones of my Magicforce.
customer_reviews.author: Jiyong Ahn

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The different light modes on this keyboard are awesome, very vibrant colors. Originally got this keyboard because I wanted to use it at work, but the blue switches are way too noisy. So now this keyboard stays at home and serves as my gaming keyboard. Comes with 5 extra blue switches and two tools to pop the keys off. I love how short and compact this keyboard is. It also has kickstands underneath to elevate the keyboard a bit. Price was very reasonable too
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Migita

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AWFUL lag
customer_reviews.text: I cannot type at a normal or even a moderate speed with this keyboard. The letters take a long time to appear, appear in the wrong order, or simply do not appear at all. It is impossible to use for typing coherently or playing games. I am extremely disappointed, because this keyboard looked very nice and I wanted it to work.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Falls short where it matters
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice. I love the layout. But, through testing, I found some serious issues. The scan rate is 60Hz at best (good keyboards are 125Hz+). It's noticeably laggy. I found that if I tap and release a key too quickly, it doesn't even register. When typing, the order of keystrokes sometimes becomes jumbled. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Good but, not all keyboards have same RGB features I guess
customer_reviews.text: Overall The keyboard works and feels fantastic, the white version luminates beautifully, however there is no option for a solid color, It appears there are different rgb controllers on some of these boards, or they have changed them since release. The caps feel great and the switches feel a bit tinny but definately feel like browns. I gave the board 3 stars because The lack of using a solid static color is a deal breaker for me, I'm not into the unicorn party effects. Everyone says there is a solid color option and using Fn + F- or F+ will adjust it but so such setting exist on mine.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Low quality switches
customer_reviews.text: I got brown switches. After 3 months the bump on the 'A' key wore down to the point where I couldn't feel the activation point (they feel like red switches when the nub wears down). Then, the space bar started double pressing. Luckily, they provide you with spare switches in a plastic bag. I resoldered and replaced the switches, which worked fine for a couple more months. Now, they've returned and the space bar and 'E' key double presses sometimes. Really disappointed I blew $50 on a keyboard that can't even last a year. I'll be spending the extra dollar on cherry from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Moon

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product life
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard indeed is compact yet has a good variety of keys. Color customization is very nice. But the unit became unreliable about a month ago (four months after purchase) and gave out completely now. Dead after five months.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: So many things wrong..
customer_reviews.text: It’s an alright keyboard, but definitely not worth the money. Both the K and the Q key switches were broken when it showed up. It did come with new ones, but I don’t feel like they should have shown up broken. The metal tool that they included was COVERED in some sticky stuff. The little baggy that all of the spare stuff came in was also sticky because of it. The cord also has a really hard time plugging into the keyboard. I don’t recommend this keyboard at all.
customer_reviews.author: Damon steele

customer_reviews.title: Just an average keyboard with lights
customer_reviews.text: Frankly this keyboard did not not live up to the hype. Everything advertised is true, but as a whole, it really feels like something worth about half the price. Guess I’m spoiled by the professional feel of my Apple and Logitech keyboards. Kind of a clackity clackity key action here with a light show going on beneath. I’ll use it in my music studio under low light conditions and learn to live with the keys. Just hope the thing holds up. It would rename it the “Ginza” for more flash than substance. Probably I’ll keep it, but honestly, overall disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bari E. Krisinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Keyboard for Budget Shoppers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for those looking for good mechanical switches under $50. I haven't had any problems with the Brown switches -- they are clicky enough to feel feedback but not too much to the point of being obnoxious. While I wish the RGB was programmable, there are enough pre-programmed effects to keep you satisfied (keep in mind there are only 7 options for solid colors (Red-Orange, Green, Royal Blue, Yellow, Hot Pink, Sky Blue, and White). The white & aluminum finish is beautiful, and this is one of the few white 60% keyboards that still manage to fit in arrow keys. You won't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mortenson Scharf

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth typing, great for gaming, very responsive. Simple to use the RGB lights. Looks gorgeous. Small hand friendly without being cramped. (I have long fingers but super narrow hands, ring size is 4.5.) Husband has a Razer keyboard, so I am used to using a high end keyboard, and this one feels great. The compact size keyboard suits my gaming style better, so it has upped my game. It's fairly quiet, which is good since I am a bit heavy fingered when I type, but has just enough nice click noise, which I find soothing. (Hubs thinks I am nuts.)
customer_reviews.author: jamn4evr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, cheap keyboard with high end features and quality for <$50
customer_reviews.text: Pros: +great quality for <$50 +lots of neat light settings and almost every setting/mode can be altered or configured in terms of brightness/pattern/speed of animation/color/etc. +keys are loud and responsive +print/typography is easy to read +has every feature I'd want from a keyboard Cons: -keys are a bit too loud for my preference, but only if I'm trying to be quiet, otherwise I don't mind and they're great. -it could stand to be a bit heavier, but it's not as if the keyboard itself has any give or flex to it. It just slides around more than i'd prefer.The kick stands might fix this problem though.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint but very noisy
customer_reviews.text: Moving from an ergonomic wave keyboard to this one saved me a ton of space on my desktop and is great, plus I like the shifting colors of the keys as a nice touch. Only issues I have with this is that the keys are just a little too close together and so I occasionally press a secondary key while typing (average sized hands). Also, the keys are VERY noisy as you type. I have to keep my mic muted constantly when in chat/meeting sessions because people on the other end just hear noisy "clacking" otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: macOS doesn't register any keystrokes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to replace another USB mechanical keyboard with blue switches. With the red switches, it has less of a clicky sound but it's still very audible. I think it's acceptable but I think I prefer the feel of the blue switch. I've only had this keyboard for a couple of days. Five times now after waking up from sleep and attempting to input my password to login, the keyboard keys light when pressed but the system (macOS Mojave) doesn't register any keystrokes. Unplugging and re-plugging the USB cable fixes it. I have never had this problem with any other USB or wireless keyboard with my system. I plan to return this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Thumb

customer_reviews.title: (EDIT: Problem Solved!) Great, budget keyboard... but one technical issue
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about this awesome keyboard being my first mechanical one, but the only drawback that I noticed was that the scroll lock color is not with the rest of the other keys which is a little distracting. EDIT: Contacted the seller, told them my issue with the scroll key being off from other keys and promptly received a functional one without sending the other back. I greatly appreciate the response to resolve it. I didn't want to give it an unsatisfied review based off that simple annoyance until I got a response from the seller which they delt with without a problem. Loving the keyboard even more!
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: One of the few 70% budget keyboards
customer_reviews.text: I really just wanted a 70% keyboard that worked and was not stupid custom level expensive. There are very few options but this is the best one I could find. I have used it for a couple of months and I am really happy with it. The construction is fairly decent. The main negative I would mention is that some of the switches have a slight metal twang to them. The keyboard came with extra switches so I swapped out the culprits and the helped. It just indicates the switch quality is only meh.
customer_reviews.author: T3Knical5urg3

customer_reviews.title: E-Element Z-88 mechanical compact keyboard, brown switch
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer. Needed a compact keyboard for general use. Love the feel of this one. Very solid, good feedback, has routing channels for the USB cable to go right, left, or center. Not into having lights blink or flash at me, so I played with it until I found a setting that has a constant backlight for the keys; handy when working in low room-light, without driving me nuts. The clicking is quite noticeable, but since there's no one close by to complain about the noise, I haven't added dampening rings just yet. May do that at some later time.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for my Blue Cherry relationship destroying keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: My wife didn't like the sound of the clicky blue keys of my previous keyboard. She graciously put up with it for 2 years till she told me how much she hated it. Now I have this one and couldn't be happier. It's excellent for limited desk space and keeping the WASD keys as close to the mouse as possible. Really comfortable for gaming. No Keypad but that doesn't bother me. Nice back-light functions. I keep it on a solid "RED" due to the distracting nature of the other functions.
customer_reviews.author: JoshK

customer_reviews.title: Compact, reliable, and customizable
customer_reviews.text: Great switches, and I love the layout. It's compact enough that I carry it to and from work each day, but it still has the function keys and a handful of others that give me a little more freedom to use a keymapper and get some extra functionality out of the board. It's easily customizable as well, which is nice. I replaced the stock keycaps (really my only complaint about the board is how "gamery" the stock caps are), and got a matching cord. Love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: cah242

customer_reviews.title: Clickety-Clack Goodness
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price range. Chose the "brown" keys as it's more mid range for typing and gaming, etc. Went from a wireless logitech keyboard and trackpad in one. It was not well designed for long useage. Bit this keyboard is awesome! Feels like it should, sounds like the Clickety-Clack it should. And fun light options as well. I chose the 10-keyless to save space and have my right hand mouse closer to the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Dane R.

customer_reviews.title: Hot swap nightmare
customer_reviews.text: After using this keyboard for sometime I decided to change out he switches. Getting the switches out is a daunting task and you will end up damaging the switches housing(switches still work). The original outemu switch pins are .03mm in size, so any switch that you want to swap out with pins need to be this size or smaller. After meticulously pulling my keyboard apart, I would guess that the manufacturing process is to put hot swap pins on each switch and place pcb on switch and solder from back of pcb. Limited customization need to order oumetu switches I guess?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Compact Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something shorter/compact and more tactile than my Kensington Slim Type keyboard. It is my first mechanical keyboard and I can't fault this keyboard for anything so far. The lights are decently bright with many nice patterns without needing SW. The keys are responsive with nice bouncy tactile feel and soft clacking sound. My typing test shows that I'm getting the maximum typing speed. It is simply a joy to type on this keyboard. I love the modified home/end/pgup/pgdn/del keys column on the far right.
customer_reviews.author: sangster

customer_reviews.title: Good price vs feature, but QC issues
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it, but then it broke. One of the switches became intermittent. I could have replaced it, but for the price, I decided it was too expensive to keep if its going to have problems this soon. It only takes specific Outemu switches. You may have to modify the switch if your going to swap everything out. I bought a couple outemu purples and I had to clip the plastic to make them fit.
customer_reviews.author: Waz

customer_reviews.title: Whoops... actually a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little keyboard in many ways! Clever, well laid-out, good feel, low price, fun color presets (not customizable but many are useful and enjoyable to watch)... I *thought* the Windows key failed. Turned out someone had hit "Fn+Win" to lock it out (a feature for gaming). Had mistakenly thought the switch failed. Amending my review to 5 stars. If you want a serious hacker keyboard or more customizable features, consider it only 4 stars... (e.g. I've used the Ultimate Hacker Keyboard, Kinesis, etc... But for the price this is a great KB).
customer_reviews.author: David K. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect. Spongy buttons.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small, white, RGB, clicky mechanical keyboard with detachable cable, and this would have been perfect if it weren't for the awful rubber dampers on some of the buttons. Most notably the enter button since that's a button that i use so much. It feels absolutely terrible every time I press it and after only a week I packed up the keyboard and went back to my old one. I also noticed that the switches don't feel quite as good my other keyboard. They both use otamu blue switches. I don't understand how the same switches can feel so different on different keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried as I thought was going to be a bigger keyboard. My nephew has another one but the keyboard keeps the lights on all night. He definitely loved this one and he said the size it’s just perfect as the other keyboard is bigger and doesn’t leave enough room on the desk while he is taking his classes online. Was worth the money and see my little nephew very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best keyboard I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I went from a Corsair keyboard to this. I needed a half keyboard, without the middle section, and this is easily the best bang for your buck. You get RGB's, mechanical, a true half keyboard, a tool to remove keys, water resistant, the wire to the keyboard has a slot to either go left/right/middle, an FN key to access functions that are cut off due to it being a true half keyboard, and it's available in white.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Tough Compact, and Clicky
customer_reviews.text: I don't like wide keyboards and my chicklet desktop keyboard #9 key died. I have not used a mechanical keyboard since my the mid 90s, and thought it was time to give it a try again. This keyboard does not disappoint. I am not a PC gamer but felt if it could stand mashing keys during a game it could handle my daily typing for work. The led pattern and lighting types is an added bonus, but I wiah you also select the color of the led in each setting. Not a deal breaker
customer_reviews.author: J. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised with this product. I do like a compact keyboard and this tenkeyless (tkl) is pretty great. The RGB lights are incredibly colorful and according to my girlfriend look like cotton candy. What I really enjoyed was the different lighting functions, each function is just as eye catching as the next. It does have mx blue switches so it is rather loud which some people will enjoy. However this keyboard does have the ability to swap Cherry MX switches so Ill most likely be switching them to mx brown switches. Great keyboard and can’t go wrong with the price.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: I want this Keyboard to work again :'(
customer_reviews.text: Aaah, this keyboard was so nice, everything about it really suited my work style greatly.. However, in just a few months, one of the keys stopped working and it only progressively got worse.. Now my A key doesn't work and that's an important key for when I play games, please work again keyboard ;; I think the issue is that there's a shortage? My keys are clean and when I replug it, it starts working again but then failing a few minutes later.. I'd really like a replacement TTT If everything worked this would have been my Number 1 Keyboard ;;
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella K.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great lighting, kinda confusing controls, doesn't transfer lighting to PC to PC so if you want a certain animation you have to cycle through the options again. Keys feel very nice and satisfying, and the build quality is perfect. The nice big and thicccccccccc font is easily readable and the lighting is perfect. Very compact, making it easy to bring to tournaments. The cable isnt braided or USB-C which is a bit disappointing, because the cable routing will ruin the cable if moved
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Chinesey, different name on box, scraps and dust from factory in box, etc.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent keyboard, but the overall quality standards are very Chinese. By that I mean the packaging was thin and rough, the name on the box doesn't match the name on Amazon. Supposedly this is "E-Element" which I think is also Hui Jo or something, but the box says "Super Scholar". So...take your pick I guess. They keyboard feels good. However, it did have scratches and scuffs on it already, and didn't look new, though it supposedly was. The metal base was scratched, and there were manufacturing scraps in the box (curls of plastic, dust, etc). That was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: GOB PROGRAM Y/N

customer_reviews.title: Just what a gammer needs.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great keyboard for the money. It has a set of very cool back lights on the keys. The mechanical operation of the keys when you press them is quite smooth and precise. The keyboard came with additional parts, for those over stroked keys during gaming. Very nice touch. The company delivery the product on time and has followed up on the sale to ensure it has met expectations. Another nice touch. I would recommend this keyboard for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Good Times

customer_reviews.title: Nice TKL
customer_reviews.text: For the price (around $40) is the best price/value TKL RGB mechanical keyboard I have tested. Good keys, good media controls and easy to clean. it comes with a nice quality removable USB Type-C cable, and a pair of extra switches and keys. I really recommended it, if you want to enter the world of mechanical keyboards, please don't buy the overpriced Corsair and Razer ones.
customer_reviews.author: TechCitizen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Again, we have to look at the item we're reviewing here: this is basically a $40 legitimate Cherry MX board (with Brown switches in my case) with fully hotswappable switches and keycaps (yes both). At this price point it a fantastic 60% board. There is no software needed, (which in my case is a good thing) and the color schemes are again, acceptable at this price point. This is clearly a Chinese product and you'll notice it because of the broken "Engrish" in the product manual but it doesn't detract from the user experience whatsoever. honestly for what it is, and what it costs...it's a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: David Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard with one annoying flaw
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is beautifully designed. All the LEDs are vibrant and the red switches are much akin to their cherry counterparts. There’s just one problem... every time I press a key, I get this ringing metal sound from the key hitting the base plate. It’s beyond annoying... is anyone else experiencing this??? I was typing harder to get the point across but normal typing results in a still audible ringing.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: key switches stopped working too fast.
customer_reviews.text: I used this keyboard for a while( around 7 months) and the WASD, T, JKL, and the final key was the spacebar. there were not enough replacement switches to fix them all and even when i did they still worked very poorly. i wish to put a good review because the first 2 months of this board were great but i cannot continue to like this keyboard because i cannot use it.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Vasallo

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep up with fast button presses and died after 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a month so far. The lights are great. But it can't keep up with how fast I am hitting multiple buttons. It often ends up putting them in the wrong order. Then today it died. Just completely died. All I do is play video games. Take good care of my things. No abusive type of treatment. Tried other USB ports, other computers, nothing. Brought my old keyboard out and am playing with that. And of course I'm 2 days past the return date. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for using at work, and it's perfect. Not too loud (actually not even 'slightly clicky' as the description says.) It feels good under the fingers, and the different colored lights are a nice touch. Feels solid and well made. The only downside is the funky font used on the keys, but it's no big deal since I'm not looking at them while I'm typing anyway. This is the second version of this keyboard I've bought (I have the much more clicky blue keyed one at home) so that's a testament to what I think of the quality I'm getting for a relatively low price.
customer_reviews.author: SWolf

customer_reviews.title: $100 quality for a whole lot less.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is insane for the price. It's really compact which is why I bought it. I am seriously impressed by this keyboard and its switches. I actually prefer it to my razor black widow. If you are looking for a low cost mechanical keyboard then this is the one. It even had way more lighting effects than they advertise. Stop reading this and buy it already!
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for programming!
customer_reviews.text: I hate the font on these keycaps so I replaced them with keycaps from another keyboard I had laying around, and put the silencer o-rings on. The keyboard is louder than I expected, but not so loud my office neighbors, who have similar keyboards, are bothered. Overall I like it and it is a solid keyboard. Sometimes if I leave it plugged into my laptop and suspend my laptop, the keyboard doesn’t wake when I raise the lid (and other things I’ve tried in the USB port on the laptop wake fine) but this is a minor downside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price but it rings like a model M
customer_reviews.text: You get a lot for the price but what bugs me the most is how much 'ping' or resonance this keyboard has. Personally it bugs me enough that I'm going to take it apart and see how to dampen the ringing. I suspect it's due to the springs in the key switches and the amount of plastic in the construction. Yet for the cost I can't complain that much. It's got hot swap switches and RGB with cool animations.
customer_reviews.author: Seth v ommen

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing keyboard.  Fantastic product, Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I ever wanted in a mechanical keyboard for a reasonable price, and more! Has many color settings, has rgb coloring, brightness adjustable backlight, no drivers needed (works on my mac flawlessly), and you can make it so it stays as just a single, solid color uniformly across all the keys as well. Also, this is a great price for what you're getting, if they sold this at a store, I'd definitely be willing to pay $80+ for this thing. 11/10, This keyboard rocks!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Although it isn't one of the $150 gaming mechanical keyboards it is a great keyboard. The blue switch version, which I got sounds just like the real cherry mx blues. Only thing that would lower my rating would be the space bar ping. Very noticable. RGB is great with many lighting effects. For instance, the rainbow one is great. There are even some RGB color switching that isn't included in the manual. Overall a great keyboard and perfect if you are going with an all white peripheral setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kylend

customer_reviews.title: Died in 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was really great while it worked. Purchased in May, it just died mid-type (December). NOTE: I am not a gamer, and use this keyboard/computer maybe 7-10 hours a week. Page says it has 12 month warranty, but I cannot seem to find a way to contact this seller. If seller can reach out and help me replace, I'll gladly update my review. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: KBay

customer_reviews.title: Keys should be a little wider
customer_reviews.text: Overall great keyboard. After comparing with a different model I realized that this keyboard needs it's keys at least one or two milimeters wider. I found myself more accurate on a keyboard with wider keys. On this keyboard I was missing my keystrokes far more often. Even after getting used to the keyboard after using it for a month I was still less accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Leonov

customer_reviews.title: Not water-proof
customer_reviews.text: While this keyboard feels great to use, I have some doubts about the "water-proof" claim due to the hole under the spacebar exposing the green circuit board (see photo). It looks like water could leak into there and cause some damage. Other than that, I really like the compact layout which reduces the distance needed to switch from the keyboard to the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Huang

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: My son kept complaining that our keyboard was lagging and he couldn't really play games well on it. So we got this keyboard for his birthday and he loves it. It apparently responds much better when he plays games and he enjoys games more since. It does click/clack much louder than normal keyboards, so just something to mention. It doesn't bother me, but my daughter didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Totally Happy. Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Received the E Element Z88 keyboard, and couldn’t be happier! The feel is great! Build quality is excellent sporting a full metal deck, detachable usb cord, 5 extra switches, a key caps puller, and switch puller! The color RGB options, are very nice as well! I’m very happy with it! Best of all, it doesn’t require a powered hub on my Raspberry Pi 3B+. Only draws 300mA! After working with this keyboard for more than two weeks, I can honestly say my opinions of this product remain the same. Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Extremely loud and shaky keys, do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this keyboard, I was extremely excited,. My old keyboard was extremely shaky and loud so I was really ready for something new. What I got was a piece of crap. The keys are extremely shaky, and the brown switches are SO loud, even more than Blue switches. There is obviously an audible click, which defeats the purpose of a brown switch. Do not buy if you want something that is advertised correctly and is of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tamar

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  Much versatility in a small package.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing for it's size. The color combinations and function are a blast. As a gamer with limited desktop space this is a perfect fit. Highly recommended. However i did discover an issue with the keyboard. it appears that there are two page down keys and no page up key. Still a great keyboard, even in QC is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard to use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade from the old generic keyboard that I have had for a while and this was definitely an upgrade. The aluminum casing around the edge of the keyboard makes it feel sturdy and not like it's made of cheap plastic. The only con I can see people having is that the keys may be too loud for some people's liking. If you have to do a lot of typing it might be a drawback. I personally don't mind it but I actually like the "clickiness" of the keyboard. Overall I do recommend if you're looking for a small keyboard that won't break the bank and does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Defective product - keystrokes are sent in the wrong order
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this keyboard I figured I couldn't go wrong with all the positive reviews. But the 1-star reviews are correct on this. Certain keys on the keyboard have a delay before the keypress is sent, so when you type certain words really fast the letters end up out of order even though you typed them correctly. If you type fast you will hate this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Neiman Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Keyboard But Cheap Plastic, Not Very Bright
customer_reviews.text: Nice Keyboard but material is very cheap. Switch echos throughout the whole keyboard. Feels very cheap but is still pretty nice for the price. The RGB Isn’t very bright also
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R parsons

customer_reviews.title: Everyone who sees mine wants one...
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard, the keys are prefect for someone like me that wants ones that depress and click when using. The backlights are nice and bright, and everyone that walks into my office comments on it and asks me where I got it. I do not actually game, I type a lot and this keyboard allows me to type fast with minimal mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: RMAC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard (brown switches)!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keybaord! Not as loud as the magicforce brown. I love the colored light display options (and I'm not even a gamer) and the media volume keys! My husband loves it too. I have little hands though so this still requires me to extend my pinkies a little more than I like when typing. Overall, amazing price and even better design and quality. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza_XZC

customer_reviews.title: Crisp keys. Bright & varied lighting. Xtra Switches!
customer_reviews.text: Theres nothing i can complain about with this keyboard. Ive had it 7 months. I had a das keyboard 4c and although this doesnt have as great of a feel, its still very nice. And sooo much cheaper. Fantastic starter mechanical keyboard. the fact it comes with spare switches is soooooo awesome. i would recommend this before anything else. ive had a few keys stop working because this keyboard took a few hits here and there. but with the easy swapping of switches, i had no problems
customer_reviews.author: J4CK

customer_reviews.title: Great 'Bang-For-Your-Buck'  Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have had the keyboard for a little less than the week and so far so good. My specific keyboard did not come with any defects that I've noticed. All the keys seem to work, along with all the different lights and their settings. I think this is a great keyboard for the price point it's at. It feels a bit cheap compared to the more expensive keyboards, but it's a great bang for your buck keyboard IMO. I'd recommend it to anyone who is in the market for their first mechanical, a backup, or is just on a little bit of a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor B.

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I own
customer_reviews.text: this blows other keyboards that I've owned out of the water. It's got everything you could ever need. Cherryish switches with full RGB lighting and integrated controls that allow you to change color settings without software (which I really like because I hate peripheral software). it's noisy but not horrifyingly so. I love the compact nature of it and it doesn't have that gamer-y look that keyboard makers try to put in their boards to market them to 12-year-old aspiring minecraft streamers. No oversize logo, no gimmick, no fuss, just a beautifully elegant and sturdy keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Butts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little keyboard... but micro usb sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little keyboard. Looks good and after almost two years of savage gaming it's still hanging like a pro. Feels great and the small size is a plus for me. I don't know if there is a control software for RGB LED control and MACROS but I don't use those anyways. You don't need software to control the default RGB combinations, just use the FN key... One bad thing.. the micro USB connector sucks and it breaks overtime. Stay away from anything that uses micro usb. It never lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Types like a dream, and CLICKITY CLACK!
customer_reviews.text: This is sharp, and way small. I had no idea it was this small, it just did not register. But thats because its just that part of the keyboard stand alone, and it's AMAZING to type on. My wife stole it from me, and her mother almost from her, I did have to get the water spray bottle out to keep them in line. This keyboard is worth the hassle tho. The clickity clack is awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: Such Anger

customer_reviews.title: Heavy use issues?
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a decently priced/decently reviewed smaller form keyboard. I bought this January 15, 2020, as of March 3, 2020 a few keys are starting to give "dead inputs". Shift Key, (D) Key, and (W) Key all will randomly not work which for some fast-paced shooters etc can be a HUGE issue. I will go to use a key to escape a situation but the buttons not working gets me killed/almost killed. It's a GREAT keyboard otherwise think I just got the lemon of the bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly like the product's durability. I have previously used two other cheaper keyboards of similar design, but they did not last more than a few months. I prefer the short keyboard because I never use the keypad on the right, and I find typing easier on this one. I originally learned to type on a mechanical typewriter. The backlight makes it easier to see the keys in a dark room, despite the black color. I also like how the keys feel when I type. I don't know what more I could ask of a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a week so far and I'm seriously loving it. The two downsides of the Z-88 in comparison to the Matias QuietPro (which I used for 2 years, but had numerous reliability and stuttering issues): - the key combination for volume up/down is less convenient - I need a separate USB hub (no USB out-ports in the keyboard itself) Aside from that, the Z-88 feels great. The keys are very responsive. The layout is good. I don't much care for the LED functionality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Couvreur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Care
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased with Andy at Spring in Original. My grandson's gaming keyboard wouldn't work after only 6 months, Amazon said they couldn't do anything as this was a 3rd party and had to be addressed directly with the Seller. It was easy to reach them and they offered helpful ideas to get at the possible problem and when these troubleshooting attempts were made and didn't work, Spring in Original sent a brand new replacement keyboard!!! We are very pleased with their excellent customer care and service!
customer_reviews.author: DMehling

customer_reviews.title: Nice first mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Nice first mechanical for me, feels like a major upgrade from a cheap rubber dome. I love the detachable cable. The LED's are really nice looking however when having them constantly lit they do emit a noise that I'm not a fan of so I have set them to illuminate only when keys are pressed. There is also a springing metallic noise when pressing keys but even with these noises this is a very nice keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive, quality gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The brown switches on mine feel very crisp and tactile. They're in a way better than the cherry mx browns if you like them to be more tactile. The only thing I don't like is that the FN key will cancel any action you making on the keyboard. If you're running in a game while pressing "W", the FN key will cancel it if you have to change volume or use the FN layer for any reason. Other wise the N key rollover works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Tt

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE PURCHASE PRICE ... USB FAILS AFTER A FEW HOURS
customer_reviews.text: I bought it and for the first three to four months it was great. However, now I can only use it a few hours before it starts having USB failures. I reconnect it and it just fails to register. Then if I change USB ports it continues to no register. Considering the cost and how long it lasted it is NOT WORTH THE PURCHASE PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Talton

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a beauty, its small and compact. The lighting effects are very cool. However, mine started bugging out after 3 weeks and by two months in it was completely dead. So I am giving it 1 star as it seems to be a keyboard that looks nice to sell but is just garbage on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful keyboard, if you like clicking sounds this is ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful keyboard, if you like clicking sounds this is perfect, the selection of colors is great, and if you are looking for something that is balanced, ie no number pad, which always makes my desk feel awkward, I do not remember instructions for adjusting the lighting on the keyboard, but, it wasn't had to find in other comments. Fn is on the other side of the keyboard than where I am used to, but I got used to it. All in all, good keyboard, I do enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Broke in six weeks. No warranty?
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after six weeks. Can’t find seller information. Q and a section shows that other people have had similar problems and haven’t been able to get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: DOA, Broken
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was not detected by windows, tried switching cables, didn't work.DOA.
customer_reviews.author: 3DPrintingTV

customer_reviews.title: So pretty and fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: IT'S SO PRETTY!!! I wanted a new backlit keyboard in white just for home use (no gaming). I love mechanical keyboards, because of the satisfying clickety clack as you type, plus the keys are customizable. The backlighting on this board is great with tons of customizable settings. So, if you want a magical, pretty keyboard that is also great quality, get this.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Nagy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty awesome lol!
customer_reviews.text: First off, the size is perfect. No unnecessary number pad and the arrow buttons are nicely designed to fit within this layout. It's a normal sized QWERTY keyboard other than that. The keys are loud, they are mechanical, and they are super responsive. Way more responsive than my razor black widow actually. The best part though, is the lighting lol. it's so fun and awesome. Who ever designed this, good freaking job because this little keyboard is cool af.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great! Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of this keyboard for the price it was. It replaced a rayzor ornata chroma mechamembrane we have had for about a year. This thing is actually amazing. Love the way it plays, the preset color patterns, and level of control you have over each colorset. My son and I love the keyboard. After using it for 3 months and trying to go back to the razyor it just does not feel the same. Keep up the quality!
customer_reviews.author: robert brydon

customer_reviews.title: Very cool lightshow, seems well-made, just one gripe
customer_reviews.text: Not much more to say about this keyboard that hasn't been said. I like it alot and I use it primarily as an add-on to my sim racing rig. The only issue that I have is that it has a distinct "buzz" noise that I assume is caused by the LED controller. If you plan on using this in a quiet environment (and being mechanical, I would bet you won't) you may have to deal with the constant buzz/ hum/ noise.
customer_reviews.author: T Wolfendale

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET FOR GAMING
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hated this keyboard. Now, first of all, it has beautiful lighting affects that I really liked. But, each keystroke I made had the worst latency I've ever experienced. Whatever you do, do not buy this keyboard for gaming you will find yourself basically lagging. For anything else, sure why not but other than that, do not buy this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: julieg

customer_reviews.title: Best one with a great price
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this all the time on PS4. We had previously purchased a “bigger and better” one that I wanted him to love and he hated it. It was very expensive and a waste. This is the perfect size and very easy to use. Remember that bigger and more expensive isn’t always better.
customer_reviews.author: Erica E.

customer_reviews.title: ... end gaming keyboards and this is one of the best I've tried and a quarter of the price
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a ton of high end gaming keyboards and this is one of the best I've tried and a quarter of the price. The brown switches feel really nice and not as mushy as red switches and not too clicky like blues. The RGB lights are preprogrammed and no software but it has a lot of nice options. It feels pretty durable and not cheap at all. My only complaint is the right shift key not being a full size as it makes replacing keycaps a little harder but it's no big deal. Overall, I completely recommend getting this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Hashemi

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was using the standard keyboard that comes with my computer, but this mechanical keyboard feels at least 5 times better. Everything was shipped perfectly and all the pieces were intact. I would definitely recommend to those who have never used a mechanical keyboard and more so to those who have never used a 60% keyboard. This is like the vanilla of mechanical keyboards, but by no means is that a bad thing. If this is your first 60%, then I would recommend doing some typing tests and possibly a rest for your wrists as this can get a little getting used to. Either way, a fantastic keyboard and I would recommend to all!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: The "A" key is defective
customer_reviews.text: I love the different light modes that you can set the keyboard to, and the sound of the keys is great. However, I've only had this keyboard for a month and I'm already having issues with the "a" key on the keyboard. I take notes for classes using this keyboard, and it's frustrating when I have to type the same word over and over again, until the "a" key registers. I don't know how long I'll have until all of the keys deteriorate as well. It's very pretty, and it's functioned well until this point.

customer_reviews.title: After 100 hours of research, this is the best keyboard under 100 dollars bar-none, and it actually costs half that.
customer_reviews.text: Double shot ABS, Tenkeyless design that's closer to 60 percent (great on ergonomics), still have nice dedicated F row, mostly standard keysizes, tons of color and speed options, open frame for easy cleaning, high quality Outemu brown switches, there's nothing more I could ask for, and for $50!!! Loved mine so much after my Blackwidow Chroma failed that my wife wanted one for her new build. This keyboard is just impossible to beat at a value perspective. I would have gladly spent almost double for these design choices.
customer_reviews.author: franklin locatis

customer_reviews.title: Great form factor with replaceable switches, even better with outemu purples. Beware of the 1.5u right shift!
customer_reviews.text: I like this layout but it's just about impossible to find a keycap set with a 1.5u shift. I plan to buy a set and will just replace both left and right shifts with blanks. I replaced the alphas and number row with outemu purples and they feel great even while the modifiers and rest of the keys are clicky blues. the backlight is kinda weak so they don't really show through the black ducky abs keys i have on at the moment but they work fine through the stock white keys.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. A.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Durable, and Responsive!
customer_reviews.text: I have limited desktop space to work with so I was in the market for a smaller keyboard that I could use for gaming. This keyboard fit the bill perfectly! The mechanical switches provide a nice loud and crisp response when pressed and the lighting is a neat touch though I don't care for it one way or the other. Definitely recommended if you are in the market for a cheap, compact, and supremely usable product. Never moving away from this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Joel Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a smaller keyboard.I was looking at TKL and 60 s. Didn't want to spend alot of money if I was just going to switch back to the one i had been using anyways(corsair k95 w/cherry reds). Picked this one up with blue switches and I love it so far. No problems,nice rgb, and I like the sound and feel of the blue switches. And its about half the size of my k95
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard 40 hours a week for work, and I love every minute. I've had more than a few keyboard in the past but this is my first mechanical and I am really impressed, one of those things you just won't get until you get for yourself. Not to mention the light show it does keeps me entertained months after getting it! Only one con and I would buy again reguardless: sometimes the caps lock key needs to be pressed twice, or more firmly to actuate. (for those who fat finger their caps this could be a perk!) 5/5 would buy again without a second thought.
customer_reviews.author: Imondeck

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely amazing keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size keyboard moving away from the 60% layout but smaller than a tkl with high quality switches for less than 40 dollars. An absolute steal for the price however in my opinion could use a don't upgrade because the "gamer-ey" cool don't isn't clean and more or less the cool flashy style would prefer something similar to the Anne pro 2 Overall an amazing buy for the price and comes with keycap puller and is has a detachable cable for easier portability, recommend this keyboard to all my friends when they want to upgrade
customer_reviews.author: CARMELO GUADALAJARA

customer_reviews.title: 6 Keys no-longer work after 2 weeks of owning
customer_reviews.text: Bought the keyboard as it has amazing reviews and seemed reliable. I know that 60$ is on the cheaper side for a mechanical keyboard but still, 60$ is a lot of money for a keyboard not to work 2 weeks after purchase. Requested a refund. I don't know if it was my copy or if it's a recurring thing but this was my experience. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: starting to go bad. very disappointedstarting to go bad. very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: i have had this keyboard for 6 months now and the h is starting to fail. function packed and all, but the quality isnt there as you might expect seller has contacted me offering a replacement and standing by their warranty. the prompt response is where they won me over. thanks
customer_reviews.author: Laura Abuzant

customer_reviews.title: Bang For Your Buck!!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for without going over my budget. It’s a quality keyboard for gaming and even other computer use. The keys are not loud and are soft to the click. Mechanical keys tend to be rough and hard, but not this one. If you are looking for something compact, reliable, and appealing then I suggest this keyboard. FYI Directions weren’t given for the light modes so I’m hoping to help some of you if you happen to read this. To switch through 7 colors use FN plus “+” “-“ To switch through light modes use FN plus “PGDN”
customer_reviews.author: Kaypossible

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, good features
customer_reviews.text: Dope keyboard, a lot of colors, sounds nice, a lot of features, easy to use, etc. Price to performance is solid, there aren't really anything bad about it. However, after just using it casually for 4 months, my d key is already kind of broken. I'm sure it won't be the same for everyone, but the quality definitely makes me question now. I used to have a cheaper keyboard, now has one or two broken keys, but I used it for over 2-3 years. Quite unfortunate I only got to use this for 4 months and I didn't purchase a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Yang

customer_reviews.title: Good layout and feel for left handed single handed use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for left-handed (single handed) use as I cannot type with my right hand. Its layout is compact which reduces strain on my shoulder as I reach across to use the arrow keys, page up and page down. It would be better if it had a Ctrl key on the right hand side for combinations like Ctrl+Alt+Del. The key lighting is nice and not too bright. It remembers its last lighting setting when unplugged which is great. I like the feel of the linear Red keys a lot. I added rubber O-rings (Three Bulls brand) to soften the end of each key's travel because my hand takes a lot of strain from typing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Great intro mech keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first mechanical keyboard, I didn't want to go all out and start with a 150$ DIY kit I'd have to solder together myself so I grabbed this 45$ one. Personally, I'm loving it. I'm not a huge fan of the 'gamer' font on the keys, but I'll eventually replace them. As it is, this seems like a fantastic entry point for people who want to get into mech keyboards but don't want to drop a whole bunch at once.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Crapping out
customer_reviews.text: After 4 to 5 months of using this keyboard, it's crapping out on me. Keys have to be pressed 2 or 3 times to type the letter, if they work at all. Even though the leds are flashing, nothing is actually working.
customer_reviews.author: brentk

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Loving the clickiness of the blue switches. This is a great keyboard: it is RGB, has hot swappable switches, and IMHO is the best layout. It's so compact but the function keys and the arrow keys keep this keyboard from becming obnoxious. I have an Anne Pro, but the reds are a little soft and there are no dedicated function and arrow keys. I thought it was too good to be true, but for $45 I can take the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: great price. One downside so far
customer_reviews.text: Backlit, consistent quality across all the switches, solid outemu switches, neat lighting patterns, each key individually lit, great price. One downside so far: The Function/Fn key is on the lower right side, and the Volume Up and Volume Down function shortcuts are on F2 and F3... so you have to streeetch your hand or use two hands. Inconvenient, but I'm fairly certain it can be remapped using 3rd-party software. Hasn't bugged me enough to make me spend time on a solution just yet.
customer_reviews.author: F.C.

customer_reviews.title: Misses keys. Laggy input.
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this keyboard, but it misses keys and transposes key presses as well. I don't think I am the fastest typist, but I do touch type and this thing constantly misses and transposes key presses. I can't give it a good review if it can't do the most essential thing of keeping up while typing.
customer_reviews.author: Offero

product_meta.title: HUO JI Z88 Z-88 RGB Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Blue Switch , LED Backlit, Water Resistant, Compact 81 Keys Anti-Ghosting for Mac, PC, White
product_meta.description:
Size:blue switches| Color:whiteEasy to Use 
The included keycap puller is for easy cleaning and maintenance.No drive needed. Plug and play. 

RGB LED Backlit Chroma Dimmable 
FN+PGDN: 10 blacklight mode, make a beautiful sight on your desk. 

N-key Rollover 
Anti-ghosting 81 keys. Each key is controlled by an independent switch, giving you very accurate response even when hitting multiple keys at the same time. Ideal for gamers, typist.. 

DIY Blue Switches 
With blue switches, it delivers a clicky and tactile feedback, sensitive and responsive. All keys support switch DIY replacement.

Compact Design 
With 81 keys, it will save a lot space on your desk. The size is smaller, the control is easier. 

Function Shortcuts Key 
It is accessible to calculator, email, web browser, volume, media etc by pressing FN+F1-F12. 

Wide Compatibility 
It is compatible with Windows10,Windows 8, Windows 7, Mac OS X, Windows XP, Windows VISTA, etc. 

Feature: 
Metal base, high quality ABS material, laser-etched, non slip design, splash proof and durable.
Keycap:Unique Bicolor mold for durable keycaps 
Key durability:Up to 50 million clicks 
Key profile:4.0+/-0.2MM 
Key strength:60+/-15g 
Key Switch Type: Blue Mechanical Switches 
1.8m bold USB cable, can be changed 

Package content 
1x mechanical keyboard
1x user manual
1x keycap puller

Warranty: 
30 day hassle-free money back guarantee 
12-months Warranty
feature_bullets: Anti-ghosting 81 keys, N-key rollover. Allowing multi-keys to work simultaneously with high speed
DIY blue switches, Custom mechanical switches designed for longevity, responsiveness and durability
10-Mode rgb backlighting and color-flashing speed, Double-shot injection molded keycaps for crystal clear backlighting
Durability and wide compatibility, Laser carving character key for long time use
Convenient multi-media keys fn+f1~f12 provides windows key lock for gaming, multimedia controls for entertainment, email and calculator

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,197 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
